TEXT.English: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.French: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.German: Willkommen in der Wüste. Ich bin Abu Yusuf Yagub. Wir können Freunde oder Feinde sein.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.
TEXT.Russian: Welcome to the desert. I am Abu Yusuf Yagub. We can be friends or enemies.

TEXT.English: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.French: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.German: Während andere Nationen Krieg führen, heiraten wir Österreicher.
TEXT.Italian: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.Spanish: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.
TEXT.Russian: While other nations go to war, we lucky Austria, we wed.

TEXT.English: Assalamu alaikum. Allah will help him who moves in the way of Allah.
TEXT.French: Assalamu alaikum. Allah will help him who moves in the way of Allah.
TEXT.German: Assalamu alaikum. Allah wird dem helfen, der seinen Weg im Namen Allahs geht.
TEXT.Italian: Assalamu alaikum. Allah will help him who moves in the way of Allah.
TEXT.Spanish: Assalamu alaikum. Allah will help him who moves in the way of Allah.
TEXT.Russian: Assalamu alaikum. Allah will help him who moves in the way of Allah.

TEXT.English: Silence! Or must I have your tongue cut out?
TEXT.German: Schweigt! Oder muss ich euch die Zunge rausschneiden?

TEXT.English: There will be no peace until you convert from your wicked ways.
TEXT.German: Es wird keinen Frieden geben solange ihr diesen finsteren Weg geht.

TEXT.English: You are my favorite infidel in the whole wide world, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Ihr seid mein liebster Ungläubiger auf der ganzen Welt, [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: What is it now, you swine-eating drunkard?
TEXT.German: Was wollt ihr nun, ihr schweinefressender Trunkenbold?

TEXT.English: Allah is watching you, [CT_NAME]. He would approve if you did this good.
TEXT.German: Allah sieht euch, [CT_NAME]. Er wird es gutheißen, wenn ihr dies tut.

TEXT.English: If you give this to me, [CT_NAME], there might be 72 virgins waiting to greet you in the afterlife!
TEXT.German: Wenn ihr dies tut, [CT_NAME], könnten 72 Jungfrauen im Jenseits auf euch warten!

TEXT.English: Mighty [OUR_CIV_SHORT] will crush your kingdom of evil if you don't obey her commands!
TEXT.German: Das mächtige [OUR_CIV_SHORT] wird euer Königkeich des Bösen vernichten, wenn ihr nicht meinem Befehl gehorcht!

TEXT.English: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.French: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.German: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.Italian: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.Spanish: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.
TEXT.Russian: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.

TEXT.English: Welcome traveller. I am Matthias Corvinus. Do you have any books to contribute to my library?
TEXT.French: Welcome traveller. I am Matthias Corvinus. Do you have any books to contribute to my library?
TEXT.German: Willkommen Reisender. Ich bin Matthias Corvinus. Habt ihr irgendwelche Bücher für meine Bibliothek?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome traveller. I am Matthias Corvinus. Do you have any books to contribute to my library?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome traveller. I am Matthias Corvinus. Do you have any books to contribute to my library?
TEXT.Russian: Welcome traveller. I am Matthias Corvinus. Do you have any books to contribute to my library?

TEXT.English: I won't change a single word with you, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Ich werde kein einziges Wort mit euch wechseln, [CT_Name]!

TEXT.English: No peace in this time between us!
TEXT.German: Es ist kein Frieden zwischen uns möglich in diesen Zeiten!

TEXT.English: God be with you, my friend [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Möge Gott mit euch sein, mein Freund [CT_Name]!

TEXT.English: You dare to bother me, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: Ihr wagt es mich anzusprechen, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: I could use some good cheer, my friend [CT_NAME]. Such a gift would surely lift my spirits!
TEXT.German: Ich könnte ein wenig Hilfe gebrauchen, mein Freund [CT_NAME]. So ein Geschenk würde meine Stimmung erhellen!

TEXT.English: Friendship between peoples is built on the share of resources; don't you think so, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: Bei Freundschaft zwischen Menschen geht es um das Teilen von Ressourcen, findet ihr nicht [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: You should try to keep me in good humour, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Ihr solltet mich bei Laune halten, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: By my beard, your lands look easily conquered!
TEXT.French: By my beard, your lands look easily conquered!
TEXT.German: Bei meinem Bart, eure Länderein sehen einfach zu erobern aus!
TEXT.Italian: By my beard, your lands look easily conquered!
TEXT.Spanish: By my beard, your lands look easily conquered!
TEXT.Russian: By my beard, your lands look easily conquered!

TEXT.English: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.French: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.German: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.Italian: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.Spanish: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.
TEXT.Russian: O how small a portion of earth will hold us when we are dead, who ambitiously seek after the whole world while we are living.

TEXT.English: Speak of the devil and the devil appears... begone, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Wenn man vom Teufel spricht, da erscheint er ... verschwindet [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: Peace? Not impossible, but right now very improbable, [CT_NAME]. You still need to be taught a lesson!
TEXT.German: Frieden? Nicht unmöglich, aber sehr unwahrscheinlich, [CT_NAME]. Ich werde euch eine Lektion erteilen!

TEXT.English: Good, good, [CT_NAME], I am glad you have come. Let us discuss our visions of glorious imperialism and colonization of the world!
TEXT.German: Gut, gut, [CT_NAME], I bin froh, dass ihr gekommen seid. Lasst uns über unsere Vision eines glorreichen Imperiums und der Kolonisation der Welt nachdenken!

TEXT.English: Time is money, [CT_NAME], and you're apparently wasting my time.
TEXT.German: Zeit ist Geld, [CT_NAME], und ihr verschwendet gerade meine Zeit.

TEXT.English: The humble realm of [OUR_CIV_SHORT] have but one small request. I am quite sure you can handle it.
TEXT.German: Das ärmliche Reich von [OUR_CIV_SHORT] hat nur ein kleines Anliegen. Ich bin sicher, ihr seid so gütig.

TEXT.English: In times of need, kindness can be very valuable.
TEXT.German: In Zeiten des Nots kann Güte sehr wertvoll sein.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], it has been brought to my attention that you have something the [OUR_EMPIRE] needs. I am sure you are willing to help us here, or else I will send my armada. Mark my words, it will not fail this time!
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], es wurde mir zugetragen ihr habt etwas von Wert für [OUR_EMPIRE]. Ich bin sicher, ihr seid geneigt uns zu helfen, oder anderfalls werde ich meine Armada schicken. Hört auf meine Worte, ich werde dieses Mal nicht versagen.

TEXT.English: I am John III Sobieski, by the grace of God King of Poland, Grand Duke of Lithuania, etc. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.French: I am John III Sobieski, by the grace of God King of Poland, Grand Duke of Lithuania, etc. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.German: Ich bin John III. Sobieski, durch die Gnade Gottes König von Polen, Großfürst von Litauen usw. Ihr dürft meine Hand küssen.
TEXT.Italian: I am John III Sobieski, by the grace of God King of Poland, Grand Duke of Lithuania, etc. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.Spanish: I am John III Sobieski, by the grace of God King of Poland, Grand Duke of Lithuania, etc. You may kiss my hand.
TEXT.Russian: I am John III Sobieski, by the grace of God King of Poland, Grand Duke of Lithuania, etc. You may kiss my hand.

TEXT.English: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.French: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.German: Willkommen an meinem Hof. Schnapp euch ein Getränk und schaut euch um. Wenn wir Freunde sind, werdet ihr vielleicht solange regieren wie ich.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.
TEXT.Russian: Welcome to my court. Grab a drink and look around. If we are friends, perhaps you will reign as long as I will.

TEXT.English: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.French: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt Freund. Was sollen wir heute erobern?
TEXT.Italian: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.Spanish: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?
TEXT.Russian: Well met friend. What shall we conquer today?

TEXT.English: Portugal shall be free, for God is on my side. Whose side are you on?
TEXT.French: Portugal shall be free, for God is on my side. Whose side are you on?
TEXT.German: Portugal soll frei sein, Gott ist auf meiner Seite. Auf wessen Seite seid ihr?
TEXT.Italian: Portugal shall be free, for God is on my side. Whose side are you on?
TEXT.Spanish: Portugal shall be free, for God is on my side. Whose side are you on?
TEXT.Russian: Portugal shall be free, for God is on my side. Whose side are you on?

TEXT.English: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.French: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.German: Ich bin Maximilian. Das Aufzählen meiner Titel würde den ganzen Tag dauern, lass uns stattdessen eine Tjost abhalten.
TEXT.Italian: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.Spanish: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.
TEXT.Russian: I am Maximilian. My titles would take all day. Let's have a good old joust instead.

TEXT.English: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.French: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.German: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.Italian: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.Spanish: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.
TEXT.Russian: By the favour shown to me by heaven, I have led the Bulgarian nation to a height of glory. Tell me about yourself.

TEXT.English: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.French: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.German: Ah, fantastisch, ein neuer Feind zu zerquetschen! Vielleicht habt ihr von mir gehört, Philip der Kühne? Nein... nun, ihr solltet.
TEXT.Italian: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.
TEXT.Russian: Ah, fantastic, a new enemy to crush! Perhaps you have heard of me, Philip the Bold? No... well, you shall.

TEXT.English: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.French: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.German: Ich habe nun über 50 Jahre in Sieg oder Frieden regiert; geliebt von meinen Leuten, gefürchtet von meinen Feinden und von meinen Verbündeten respektiert.
TEXT.Italian: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.Spanish: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!
TEXT.Russian: I have now reigned above fifty years in victory or peace; beloved by my subjects, dreaded by my enemies, and respected by my allies. O man! place not thy confidence in this present world!

TEXT.English: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.French: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.German: Ich bin Simone Boccanegra, erster Doge von Genua. Ihr sing nicht zufällig, oder?
TEXT.Italian: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.Spanish: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?
TEXT.Russian: I am Simone Boccanegra, first Doge of Genoa. You don't sing by any chance, do you?

TEXT.English: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.French: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.German: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.Italian: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.Spanish: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.
TEXT.Russian: Be strong lest prosperity lifts you up too much or adversity cast you down. Be humble in this life that God may raise you up in the next.

TEXT.English: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.French: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.German: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.Italian: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.Spanish: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.
TEXT.Russian: To quote my patron saint: Nothing in this inconstant life can weaken my resolve to serve God.

TEXT.English: I do not speak to those who are disloyal to me! Go away I said!
TEXT.German: Ich spreche nicht mit denjenigen, die mir gegenüber treulos sind. Geht weg, hab ich gesagt!

TEXT.English: So, you want peace? No, you'll have to beat me first! Good luck, [CT_NAME]!
TEXT.German: Ihr wollt also Frieden? Nein, ihr müsst mich erst besiegen! Viel Glück, [CT_NAME]!

TEXT.English: Oh, hello, [CT_NAME]! Welcome again to my glorious lands! Do you have any daughters my sons can marry?
TEXT.German: Oh, Hallo [CT_NAME]! Willkommen in meinem glorreichen Land! Habt ihr irgendwelche Töchter die meine Söhne heiraten könnten?

TEXT.English: Speak faster, [CT_NAME], I have no time for the likes of you. My laws won't write themselves, you know!
TEXT.German: Sprecht schneller,[CT_NAME]. Ich habe keine Zeit für euresgleichen. Meine Gesetze schreiben sich nicht von selbst, wisst ihr.

TEXT.English: As a patron of learning, I'd like some help from you to educate my society. Do we have a deal?
TEXT.German: Als Förderer des Wissen würde ich gerne diese Hilfe von euch in Anspruch nehmen um mein Volk zu auszubilden. Schlagt ihr ein?

TEXT.English: If you don't want to make me mad I suggest you give me this. You don't want to spoil our relations, do you?
TEXT.German: Wenn ihr mich nicht sauer machen wollt, dann schlage ich vor ihr gebt mir dies. Ihr wollt unsere Beziehungen nicht verderben, oder?

TEXT.English: I suggest you give us this if you don't want to spend the rest of your life imprisoned like my brother...
TEXT.German: Ich schlage vor ihr gebt uns dies, wenn ihr nicht den Rest eures Leben eingekerkert sein wollt wie mein Bruder...

TEXT.English: I am Casimir. Will you help me make Poland great?
TEXT.French: I am Casimir. Will you help me make Poland great?
TEXT.German: Ich bin Casimir. Werdet ihr mir helfen Polen zu Größe zu verhelfen?
TEXT.Italian: I am Casimir. Will you help me make Poland great?
TEXT.Spanish: I am Casimir. Will you help me make Poland great?
TEXT.Russian: I am Casimir. Will you help me make Poland great?

TEXT.English: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.French: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.German: Gott ist mein Schild!
TEXT.Italian: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.Spanish: The Lord God is my armor!
TEXT.Russian: The Lord God is my armor!

TEXT.English: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.French: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.German: Ich weiß worauf ihr hinaus wollt, wisst ihr.
TEXT.Italian: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.Spanish: I can see what you're up to, you know.
TEXT.Russian: I can see what you're up to, you know.

TEXT.English: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.French: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.German: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Willkommen, mein Kind.
TEXT.Italian: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.Spanish: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.
TEXT.Russian: In nomine Patris, et Filii, et Spiritus Sancti. Welcome, my child.

TEXT.English: Two Romes have fallen and the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.French: Two Romes have fallen and the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.German: Zwei Roms sind gefallen und ein Drittes existiert, und es wird kein Viertes geben.
TEXT.Italian: Two Romes have fallen and the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.Spanish: Two Romes have fallen and the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
TEXT.Russian: Two Romes have fallen and the third exists, and there will not be a fourth.
